seacondition module¶

  • University of Stavanger

  • Hui Cheng (PhD student)

  • Lin Li (Medveileder)

  • Prof. Muk Chen Ong (Supervisor)

Any questions about this code, please email: hui.cheng@uis.no

A module can be used to provide the wave velocity In order to use this module, we recommend import seacondition as sc in the beginning of your code.

Note

In this library, I assume the wave is coming from -X, and long X-axis, Z is the gravity direction,Z=0 is the water level, and the water is below z=0.

reference: 2000linearwavetheory_NTNU.pdf

class seacondition.Airywave(waveHeight=1.0, waveLength=25.0, waterDepth=60.0)¶

Bases: object

Using Airy wave theory

Parameters

  • waveHeight – [float] Unit: [m]. wave height.

  • waveLength – [float] Unit: [m]. wavelength.

  • waterDepth – [float] Unit: [m]. water depth.

get_acceleration(posi, time)¶
Parameters

  • posi – [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m]. The position of the point which you want to know the wave acceleration.

  • time – [float] Unit: [s]. The time which you want to know the wave velocity

Returns

[np.array].shape=(1,3) Unit: [m/s]. A numpy array of the acceleration at the targeted point.

get_surface(positions, time)¶

A class private function.

Parameters

  • positions – [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m]. The position of the point which you want to know the wave velocity or acceleration.

  • time – [float] Unit: [s].

Returns

[float] Unit: [m]. The sea surface level in Z direction. At the targeted position.

get_velocity(posi, time)¶
Parameters

  • posi – [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of coordinates Unit: [m]. The position of the point which you want to know the wave velocity

  • time – [float] Unit: [s]. The time which you want to know the wave velocity

Returns

[np.array].shape=(1,3) Unit: [m/s]. A numpy array of the velocity at the targeted point.

get_velocity_at_elements(position_nodes, elements, global_time)¶
Parameters

  • position_nodes – a numpy list of position

  • elements – a python list of element

  • global_time – time [s]

Returns

Get a numpy array of velocity at a list of elements

get_velocity_at_nodes(list_of_point, global_time)¶

Public function.

Parameters

  • list_of_point – [np.array].shape=(n,3) Unit: [m]. A list of points’s positions

  • global_time – [float] Unit: [s]. Physical time.

Returns

Get a list of velocity at a list of point
